alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 26 at 8:39AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Total snow accumulations ranging anywhere from 2 to 8 inches. Northwest winds sustained at 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...A prolonged period of dangerous travel conditions associated with accumulating snow, strong northwesterly winds and blowing snow. Travel will be hazardous and road closures are occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds are forecasted to be strongest in Eastern Colorado and adjacent Kansas border counties where sustained winds may reach 30 to 45 mph and gusts up to 65 mph are possible. Wind of this magnitude may result in power outages and property damage. Outdoor holiday decorations are especially vulnerable.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
